> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, cantab said:
> 
> 
> Asclepius supports New Horizons too, the config for that being distributed with Asclepius and putting that world opposite Laythe.
> 

It's at laythes L3 and they both have one moon. So it's a really cool setup!

Meanwhile in old New Horizons, I noticed the Mun orbit bug had kicked my abandoned station out and left it orbiting Sonnah slightly further than the Mun, with 230 m/s left in the tanks. So I did what I do best: snagged a Mun assist onto a Kerbin assist to get a Serran encounter, and now the station is in a hopefully bug-free orbit round Serran ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") (Scruffy high polar orbit, but it's a safe place to park the station until I refuel it).
Assuming I don't leave things on Serran or aptur, could I start a game with new horizons 1 and upgrade to 2.0 when it comes out?

Uuh... [@KillAshley](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/128696-killashley/), do you perhaps know where the Kopernicus thread and the KCM thread went? I can't find them, nor can I find Thomas...

Edit: Kopernicus thread is back, no worries.

does anyone know how to use the EVE clouds? i can't seem to figure it out ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:")

NH2 may be just around the corner, but I'm not letting that stop me from getting on with my basebuilding in NH1. First module!

And only now do I notice the solars will be in the way of docking the next module. D'oh. Ah well, I can retract one of them.

[![We have confirmed LIFTOFF from Serran](https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7231/26728008834_34730aa0f4_b.jpg)](https://flic.kr/p/GHS2Qw)

very cool.

hey just a quick message to everyone, I know  I am close to finishing NH2.0, however the last week I've been hit by not only a lot of work, but a complete lack of inspiration. My motivation to finish the update is there, however the inspiration to continue has disappeared. In the mean time I've been taking a small break (which is why I haven't really been replying) to clear my head. Hopefully it wont be long until i get my mojo back and slam the few remaining details out for all of you ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

My motivation to finish the update is there, however the inspiration to continue has disappeared. Hopefully it wont be long until i get my mojo back and slam the few remaining details out for all of you ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
> 

I know the feeling. I hope you are able to get back to coding sooner rather than later.
Take all the time you need, 1.7 is awesome enough to last a few more weeks ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

In the meantime will 1.7 work in 1.1.2? 

Because I know some of the older 1.0.5 planet packs work in 1.1.2

Works for me. The planets all load in their correct orbits and as you can see above I landed on one without a hitch. I've encountered the odd graphical glitch, like Leouch's atmosphere being invisible, but nothing serious.
All the configs for all planets will work in 1.1.2 because Kopernicus hasn't changed how a config is read and interpreted

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, Kepler68 said:
> 
> 
> EDIT2: does anyone know how to get a picture to show up on here?
> 

In the post editor, at the lower right, click "insert other media" and choose "Insert image from URL". You cannot attach files to posts, that has been disabled here since day one.

As such, upload the picture somewhere, like imgur, Dropbox or the like.

Instead of a direct image isnertion, you can also just make a bog-standard text hyperlink that people can click.

If you need any micro-help(Which you won't [@KillAshley](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/128696-killashley/) Because your a boss), I am willing to. My knowledge of Coding is at best Mid-Amateur level for ksp planets but i am always happy to learn anything new. (I Love year 11/School)(Aussie).

I'm very new to KSP and even in stock never left Kerbin. I started a science save (Career is broken for me) and would really hate to loose it. I am still really hyped for NH 2.0 but I hope I don't have to start a new save. Also, when is 2.0 being released? I'm hope its before school holidays so I can start my new career then.
